CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, October 8, 1960, pg. 1, reads: "No. 1 Clemente Rooters - There were no more staunch rooters for Roberto Clemente, sparkling outfielder for the Pirates, in opening game of the World Series than his mother, Mrs. Luisa Clemente, and his brother, Justino. Both made the plane trip from their home in Puerto Rico at the invitation of 'Mr. Rightfielder.'  Mrs. Clemente came despite convalescense from a recent attack of influenza. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Spectators, including Luisa Clemente, mother of Roberto Clemente, and brother Justino Clemente, in stands at 1960 World Series opening baseball game with Pittsburgh Pirates, Forbes Field
